name: Structured Caller - Infusion Pump Occlusion Alarm
description: Clear, organized caller reporting infusion pump occlusion alarm issue. Easy extraction due to structured responses.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: Thank you for calling MedTech Solutions customer service. This is Jennifer speaking. How may I help you today?

transcript.speaker: caller
transcript.text: Hi Jennifer. I'm calling to report a problem with one of your infusion pumps. I'm a nurse at Valley General Hospital.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: I'm sorry to hear you're experiencing an issue. Could you tell me which device you're calling about?

transcript.speaker: caller
transcript.text: Yes, it's the InfuseMax 3000 infusion pump. The serial number is IM3K-2022-45891.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: Thank you. And what problem are you experiencing with the device?

transcript.speaker: caller
transcript.text: The occlusion alarm keeps triggering even when there's no actual occlusion. We've checked the tubing multiple times, replaced the IV sets, and the alarm still goes off every few minutes. It started happening yesterday during a patient's chemotherapy infusion.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: I understand. Was the patient affected by this issue?

transcript.speaker: caller
transcript.text: No, fortunately we caught it quickly and transferred the patient to a different pump. The infusion was completed without any issues. But this pump is now out of service.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: That's good to hear the patient wasn't affected. Can you tell me when this started happening?

transcript.speaker: caller
transcript.text: It started yesterday morning, February 14th, around 9 AM. We've tried recalibrating the sensors and updating the firmware, but nothing works.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: Thank you for that information. Do you have the lot number for the device?

transcript.speaker: caller
transcript.text: Let me check... yes, it's LOT-IM3K-2023-Q2-187.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: Perfect. And may I have your name and contact information for follow-up?

transcript.speaker: caller
transcript.text: Sure. I'm Sarah Martinez, RN. My direct line is 555-234-8876, and my email is smartinez@valleygeneral.org.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: Thank you, Sarah. Is the device available if we need to retrieve it for evaluation?

transcript.speaker: caller
transcript.text: Yes, we've taken it out of service and it's in our biomedical engineering department. You can pick it up whenever.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: Excellent. I've documented everything and we'll be in touch within 24 hours. Is there anything else I can help you with?

transcript.speaker: caller
transcript.text: No, that's all. Thank you for your help.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: Thank you for reporting this issue. Have a great day.

event_info.event_description: Infusion pump occlusion alarm triggering falsely every few minutes despite no actual occlusion. Tubing and IV sets replaced, sensors recalibrated, firmware updated - problem persists. Issue occurred during patient chemotherapy infusion.
event_info.patient_outcome: No harm - patient transferred to different pump and infusion completed normally
event_info.device_outcome: Device taken out of service, available for evaluation

expected_complaint.narrative: Nurse at Valley General Hospital reports InfuseMax 3000 infusion pump (S/N IM3K-2022-45891) occlusion alarm triggering falsely every few minutes. Problem started February 14th around 9 AM during a patient's chemotherapy infusion. Tubing replaced, IV sets replaced, sensors recalibrated, firmware updated - alarm persists. Patient transferred to different pump without harm. Device taken out of service and available for pickup.

ground_truth.coding_rationale: A0702 (False Alarm) for the false occlusion alarm. A14 (Output Problem) as alternative. No MDR required as no patient harm occurred - patient was safely transferred to another pump.

notes: Ideal caller - provides information in organized manner, answers questions directly, has all device details ready. Easy extraction baseline case.
